Kenya, Ethiopia confirm their first new coronavirus cases
Kenya and Ethiopia confirmed their first cases of the new coronavirus on Friday, a woman who had returned to Nairobi from the United States and a Japanese national in Addis Ababa. Authorities in Nairobi banned all major public events and said they would restrict foreign travel in the wake of East Africa’s first reported case,

Albany County announces 2 new cases of coronavirus
Albany County has announced two new cases of coronavirus, bringing the total to four positive cases in the county. The county announced on Thursday that a Guilderland woman in her 30s and a UAlbany student in his 20s tested positive for the virus. County officials say the new cases are directly related to one of the cases announced on Thursday.

27 new coronavirus cases in Ireland as schools and public buildings shut
Some 27 new cases of Covid-19 were confirmed in Ireland last night after the government announced a range of unprecedented measures to try to contain the spread of the virus. Schools, universities, crèches and other public facilities have been closed for the next two weeks while restrictions are in place on public gatherings. Leo Varadkar said ...

Coronavirus: First death confirmed in India
India has recorded its first death linked to the coronavirus, officials have confirmed. The 76-year-old man, from the southern state of Karnataka, returned from Saudi Arabia on 29 February after a month-long visit. People who came in contact with the man, who died on Tuesday, are being traced and quarantined, the state's health minister said.
